meanings.definition: To run back; to return by running.
meanings.sent1: After realizing he forgot his keys, he had to runback to the house.
meanings.sent2: She decided to runback to the store to grab the item she had missed.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel did a quick runback to its tree after spotting a cat nearby.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood runback to her mind like a movie reel.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ice cream truck made the kids runback with excitement.

meanings.definition: A return run, especially in sports.
meanings.sent1: The player's runback for a touchdown secured the team's victory.
meanings.sent2: The runback by the receiver was impressive, gaining significant yardage.
meanings.sent3: The runback of the ball by the goalie surprised everyone on the field.
meanings.sent4: His runback in the game was like a lightning bolt, swift and unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The runback in the final minutes of the match changed the outcome completely.

meanings.sent1: The runback of the dog to its owner was heartwarming.
meanings.sent2: The runback of the marathon runner was cheered on by the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The runback of the child to get his forgotten toy was comical.
meanings.sent4: Her runback in the race was a display of determination and strength.
meanings.sent5: The runback of the hiker to the starting point marked the end of the journey.
